bibl.title: Military Orders for Robert P. Cooke, September 13, 1900

div1.p: Special Orders #158 directs Cooke to the ship, Crook, to act as attending surgeon on board. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Robert P. Cooke, September 13, 1900
div1.p:
Adjutant General's
OFFICE.
SEP 28 1900
ROLLS DIVISION.
[unclear]

ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
RECD. SEP 22 1900

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 175 A
1900

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, September 13, 1900.

Upon the request of the commanding officer, trans-
port Crook, and representation that the Acting Assistant
Surgeon of said transport is unable to discharge his duties,
Acting Assistant Surgeon Robert P. Cooke, U. S. Army,
now on duty at Columbia Barracks, Cuba, will proceed at
once to Havana and report to the commanding officer of
the transport Crook, for duty as attending surgeon on
said transport from Havana to New York City, New York.

Acting Assistant Surgeon Cooke will upon completion of
this duty return by the first available transport to Havana,
Cuba, and thence rejoin his proper station, Columbia Bar-
racks, Cuba.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:
